intro: Oenanthe amoena, commonly known as the white water-dropwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found near streams and wetlands. Oenanthe amoena is also known for its mild, aromatic scent and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
